I highly reclined running hot water through it alone first and then making coffee. title: Love it!
body: I am so pleased with this little espresso maker. I have an espresso machine at home that I typically use on a daily but there are days when I wake up late and don‚Äôt have time to use it. I grab this little beauty, my barista kit and my premeasured espresso that I keep in packets in the freezer. As long as I have access to hot water, I can make my Beautiful little double anywhere! It‚Äôs super easy to use and not too big of a pain to clean. I‚Äôve taken it to work, camping, and while I‚Äôm traveling. The only thing negative I can come up with is the fact that it tells you to weight out 16 g of espresso, but 16 g of espresso doesn‚Äôt fit in the little porta filters. Its less, somewhere in between 14 and 15. One of these days I‚Äôll spend the time to figure out exactly how much so I don‚Äôt have espresso waste. I am quite impressed with a crema that this thing produces and overall just thrilled with my purchase! The grinder is for sure next on my list of things to purchase. I have to be honest I think I‚Äôm just a big fan of the brand I haven‚Äôt been disappointed yet.

title: Spectacular for the Trail or Road
body:
I've been using this little beauty on my drives from the United States to Costa Rica and back. Super simple, this produces a fantastic tasting espresso, and a lovely long shot.

I have not yet had any issues with it, despite about 3 months of nearly daily use. If I run into anything, I will update. However, at this point, this machine is putting out some fantastic drinks with consistency, reliability, and simplicity. I love it!

Edit: Having used this nearly daily for 8 months, I have a couple of additions. The device still makes a delightful little drink, but I've now run into a couple of issues. The pump arm/piston now leaks a bit of water around it as you pump, and sometimes you have to prime the pump quite a lot to get it to work. Otherwise, this machine continues to impress. Almost wish there were an aircraft titanium upgrade for those of us who want this to outlast us and go to our kids or maybe survive those of us who need extra tough gear (savages, barbarians, wildmen). Just a thought from a knuckle dragger.

title: My best purchase in 2020 hands down
body: I love this little machine so much. I bought this to save money on lattes and it tastes just as good as any coffee shop. It has great body and core and the crema on top is picture perfect. I was saving up for a $500+ espresso machine but I might spend it on something else now as I am satisfied with this. I am so happy with this I actually enjoy my mornings and even look forward to waking up and drinking a double shot espresso or a latte before I start the day. I recommend to buy the barista kit for the extra baskets and the ability to make a double shot latte quickly. I don't own the nespresso adapter as I like freshly grinding my beans so I can't comment on that attachment. Anyone who likes espresso I would reccomend and definitely over cheaper espresso machines. The only people I wouldnt reccomend are people who don't want to be hands on in the espresso making process or if you have arthritis in your hands.
